l:dependency.name: Jackson 2 API Plugin
l:dependency.l:description: This plugin exposes the Jackson 2 JSON APIs to other Jenkins plugins.

l:dependency.name: jackson-databind
l:dependency.l:description: General data-binding functionality for Jackson: works on core streaming API

l:dependency.name: Jackson-annotations
l:dependency.l:description: Core annotations used for value types, used by Jackson data binding package.

l:dependency.name: Jackson-dataformat-YAML
l:dependency.l:description: Support for reading and writing YAML-encoded data via Jackson abstractions.

l:dependency.name: Jackson module: JAXB Annotations
l:dependency.l:description: Support for using JAXB annotations as an alternative to "native" Jackson annotations, for configuring data-binding.

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: jdk8
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support JDK 8 data types.

l:dependency.name: Jackson-core
l:dependency.l:description: Core Jackson processing abstractions (aka Streaming API), implementation for JSON

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: org.json
l:dependency.l:description: Support for datatypes of "org.json" JSON library (see http://json.org/java), mainly to make it easier to upgrade code to Jackson, using automated conversions.

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: JSR310
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module to support JSR-310 (Java 8 Date & Time API) data types.

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.

l:dependency.name: Jackson-module-parameter-names
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support introspection of method/constructor parameter names, without having to add explicit property name annotation.
